column4: Anybody know why X might fail to start when startx is run by a normal user, but starts OK when startx is run by root?
permissions.
what permissions?  .Xauthority files removed and still does not work ... no errors in logs
well, that sounds like the kind of thing that would be caused by permissions, don't you think?
absolutely ... I just can't find anything wrong with the permissions :(
there may be more things than just that .XAuthority
prolly ... but I can't figure out what.  And I would expect some errors in the logs indicating such.
do you have gdm installed?
yeah (either that or Xdm ... whatever the Xubuntu default is)
does that start?
yes ... but when i try to log on as my regular user, it just goes back to the display manager logon screen after blanking for a few secs
so it is not X that is not starting, but rather you can't log in.
hmmm... lemme think about that
what are the permissions and ownership like on .dmrc?
sec
sry in middle of a reboot atm
-rw-r--r--
your user the owner?
chmod 77 -> same prob
y
I've been thinking about what u said re: logging on -vs- starting server.  I think the problem is that a non-root user cannot start X.  gdm is run with root priv's is it not?
Maybe not ... perhaps the server starts OK, then crashes when trying to authenticate a non-root client.  If it crashes bad enough maybe it dies before it can log anything.
